instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Machine not turning on.
AMP Meter stuck at 5V.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 1V.
Diode Mode Reading to Ground is .511

No sign of corossion on the board.

Getting 5V on <CAPACITOR>C5201</CAPACITOR>.
<RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>/62 is 1.3 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R5221</RESISTOR> is 1.3 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR> is 31.2 kOhms.

Should we replace <RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR> ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Replaced <RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR>.

Now the value is fine.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> is 12.2 - 12.3V. Going back and forth.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S2</SIGNAL> is 0V and Diode Mode is 0.280

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is 0.2V and 0.452

<SIGNAL>PP1V25_S2</SIGNAL> is 0.03 and 0.290.

<SIGNAL>P5VS2_EN</SIGNAL> is Missing.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_5VS2_VIN</SIGNAL> = <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>.


Should we go for a DFU Revive.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Be sure first no short on any secondary power supply.
Do you get expected LDOs from <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
I have mentioned the LDO Readings 
[QUOTE]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is 0.2V and 0.452

<SIGNAL>PP1V25_S2</SIGNAL> is 0.03 and 0.290.
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Really, are these all???

Is it recognized in DFU at least?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Can you please help me with the other LDOs.

Not recognised in DFU.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: I just realized you didn't say anything about <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: 3V8_AON_VDDMAIN is 3.8V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: Then check the expected LDOs from pages 34 & 29.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Page 29. LDO of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>

pp1v23_s2
<SIGNAL>PPVDD_PMU_LDO_PREREG</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V06_S2SW_DRAM</SIGNAL>
pp0v8_s1

all are 0V. Should we check further ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
That is the slave PMU.
You should start with master <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.
In fact, I mentioned first page 34...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
<CHIP>U8100</CHIP>

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> is 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is 0.1V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> missing also?
If none of these LDOs is shorted (or very low resistance) to ground, then bad <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Yes <SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> is missing too.

All have good diode mode readings.

Should we remove and re install or replace ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Ideally replace with known good.
If you have doubts about solders, reball and resolder it.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Just posting LDO Diode Mode Readings again before ordering the PMIC.

3v8_AON_VDDMAIn is .172
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL> is .238
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> is .353
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> is .465
<SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> is .586
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL> is .457


Are these okay. Should i order a PMIC

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Use reference table, if no good board available for comparison.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: Replaced <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> with a new chip. Still the same.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: Do you get its LDOs now?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message: no

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Check for short on its LDOs.
Compare readings with good board.
If OK, bad chip; may also have bad solders...
